{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3391537,"name":"Brennyn","username":"Prinkle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/prinkle/{size}/258824_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-24T16:01:52.375Z","cooked":"

I was looking at buy Kraken X60s early for the 2025 season and thought about how CTRE ended up releasing the Falcon 2.0. Does anyone know of any speculation about Kraken 2.0s coming out before the 2025 season begins before we spend so much on new ones.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2024-05-24T16:01:52.375Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":143,"reads":1385,"readers_count":1384,"score":1007.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":466857,"topic_slug":"kraken-2-0-speculation","display_username":"Brennyn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55024,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"862 VPE / Driver"},"post_url":"/t/kraken-2-0-speculation/466857/1","custom_user_title":"862 VPE / Driver","reactions":[{"id":"question","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3391538,"name":"Paul Regnier","username":"Paul_R","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/paul_r/{size}/203827_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-24T16:02:51.723Z","cooked":"

What suggests there even will be a Kraken 2.0 soon?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2024-05-24T16:02:59.287Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":1385,"readers_count":1384,"score":637.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":466857,"topic_slug":"kraken-2-0-speculation","display_username":"Paul Regnier","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":24}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61214,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2102 Lead Programmer and OA Lead"},"post_url":"/t/kraken-2-0-speculation/466857/2","custom_user_title":"2102 Lead Programmer and OA Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":18},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":24,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3391540,"name":"Eliot Dunn","username":"Eliot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eliot/{size}/207280_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-24T16:07:14.222Z","cooked":"

There really haven’t been too many issues with the kraken and it already is very powerful. I doubt it will get a 2.0 for a while. Maybe a 1.1 with small hardware changes.

There are around three brushless 775 class motors in development (I think), but those don’t really replace the CIM class Kraken.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2024-05-24T16:07:34.945Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":1381,"readers_count":1380,"score":466.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":466857,"topic_slug":"kraken-2-0-speculation","display_username":"Eliot Dunn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":17}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52966,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"111 Alum"},"post_url":"/t/kraken-2-0-speculation/466857/3","custom_user_title":"111 Alum","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":12},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":17,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3391542,"name":"Pizzatc","username":"Pizzatc","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pizzatc/{size}/207342_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-24T16:09:34.433Z","cooked":"

There really isn’t demand for any sort of update. They’ve been very reliable with little problems so if there is going to be an update its going to be to fix those issues that 1% of people have.

thats what i was thinking like i said it was just a thought i had before buying a bunch of new ones

I wouldn’t expect to see anything significant changed for 2025. Maybe minor production changes to address any complaints they might have gotten, but I don’t think you’re going to see a v2 with meaningfully different specs be released anytime soon.

Eliot Dunn:

There are around three brushless 775 class motors in development

I am out of the loop, who is developing these?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2024-05-24T17:44:24.168Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":1006,"readers_count":1005,"score":216.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":466857,"topic_slug":"kraken-2-0-speculation","display_username":"Patrick McNaughton","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54656,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"341 | Co-Captain"},"post_url":"/t/kraken-2-0-speculation/466857/8","custom_user_title":"341 | Co-Captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3391616,"name":"Cooper Surma","username":"CooperSurma","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/coopersurma/{size}/232004_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-24T17:52:14.900Z","cooked":"

I know one is from Redux (and is quite far along), and while I’m not sure on the others, I’m guessing REV and CTRE/WCP since they are really the only names in the motor market right now.

Edit: One of the others is TTB, so I’m guessing 3 is Rev

Redux had a concept at the Vendor Booths at worlds this year. IIRC it’s rumored to be as strong as a NEO in terms of power output? Don’t quote me on that, though.
Link: Supplier Booth Reveals Roundup? - #18 by Eeshwar

Must have missed it

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2024-05-24T17:54:50.899Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":914,"readers_count":913,"score":202.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":466857,"topic_slug":"kraken-2-0-speculation","display_username":"Patrick McNaughton","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":58757,"username":"GenericUserPerson","name":"Joe Schmo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/13edae/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54656,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"341 | Co-Captain"},"post_url":"/t/kraken-2-0-speculation/466857/11","custom_user_title":"341 | Co-Captain","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3391743,"name":"Eliot Dunn","username":"Eliot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eliot/{size}/207280_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-25T00:28:38.478Z","cooked":"

Redux and TTB have shown prototypes at champs.
Neither have a confirmed release date. From what I’ve seen, Redux is a bit farther along.

WCP I’m assuming because they designed swerveXS for a 775 and no one wants to used a brushed motor for swerve steering if they can help it.

I doubt REV is developing a 775 considering they already have three brushless motors on the market and a ton on their plate.

Going from 42 CPR to 2048 CPR is like going from taking a horse and buggy to school to taking a modern day automobile. Going from 2048 CPR to 7168 CPR is like going from taking a modern day automobile to school to taking a private jet to school.

The jet is faster, sure, but way overkill for the job of getting to the school a couple miles away (unless you’re Taylor Swift, but Taylor Swift can go ahead and use a 7168 CPR encoder if she wants, that’s her prerogative).
